labels.analysis: The MCP Server is designed to enhance productivity by providing advanced task and project management capabilities through natural language interactions with Todoist. It allows users to create, update, organize, and search tasks, projects, labels, and sections using everyday language, leveraging an LLM for seamless AI-driven workflows. The toolset includes various operations for managing tasks, projects, labels, and sections, making it highly versatile for personal and professional organization.
labels.reasoning: The primary function of this server is to manage tasks and projects, aligning closely with the "Daily Productivity" category. The natural language integration and AI-driven workflows could also be highlighted as an "AI/ML Tools" aspect, given the LLM interaction. The server's focus on batch operations and filtering is indicative of productivity optimization, further supporting the primary label.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Todoist Extended Task Manager
server_info_crawled.author: @HitmanLy007/todoist-mcp-server-extended
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable natural language task and project management by integrating your Todoist account with an LLM via MCP tools. Create, update, organize, and search tasks, projects, labels, and sections effortlessly using everyday language. Optimize your workflow with batch operations and flexible filtering designed for AI interaction.

tools.name: todoist_create_task
tools.description: Deploy Server Todoist Extended Task Manager @HitmanLy007/todoist-mcp-server-extended Try in Playground todoist_create_task

tools.name: todoist_get_tasks
tools.description: Get a list of tasks from Todoist with various filters - handles both single and batch retrieval

tools.name: todoist_update_task
tools.description: Update one or more tasks in Todoist with full parameter support

tools.name: todoist_delete_task
tools.description: Delete one or more tasks from Todoist

tools.name: todoist_complete_task
tools.description: Mark one or more tasks as complete in Todoist

tools.name: todoist_get_projects
tools.description: Get projects with optional filtering and hierarchy information

tools.name: todoist_create_project
tools.description: Create one or more projects with support for nested hierarchies

tools.name: todoist_update_project
tools.description: Update one or more projects in Todoist

tools.name: todoist_get_project_sections
tools.description: Get sections from one or more projects in Todoist

tools.name: todoist_create_project_section
tools.description: Create one or more sections in Todoist projects

tools.name: todoist_get_personal_labels
tools.description: Get all personal labels from Todoist

tools.name: todoist_create_personal_label
tools.description: Create one or more personal labels in Todoist

tools.name: todoist_get_personal_label
tools.description: Get a personal label by ID

tools.name: todoist_update_personal_label
tools.description: Update one or more existing personal labels in Todoist

tools.name: todoist_delete_personal_label
tools.description: Delete a personal label from Todoist

tools.name: todoist_get_shared_labels
tools.description: Get all shared labels from Todoist

tools.name: todoist_rename_shared_labels
tools.description: Rename one or more shared labels in Todoist

tools.name: todoist_remove_shared_labels
tools.description: Remove one or more shared labels from Todoist tasks

tools.name: todoist_update_task_labels
tools.description: Update the labels of one or more tasks in Todoist

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@HitmanLy007/todoist-mcp-server-extended/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: todoistApiToken
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: The API token for accessing Todoist API.
